name: Chicken Cottage Cheese Alfredo Pasta
label: Italian

ingredients.name: Finely grated Parmesan cheese
ingredients.quantity: 1 cup (2 1/2 ounces), plus more for serving

instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and cook your past choice according to package instructions until al dente. Drain but keep 1 cup of pasta water (in case needed for sauce later) and set aside.
Pin-roll the chicken (for juicy taste) then season both sides with Italian seasoning, paprika, kosher salt, and black pepper.
In a blender, mix in the Cottage cheese, milk, parmesan cheese, and arrowroot powder, and nutmeg (about 60 seconds or until creamy) and set aside.

In a large skillet, heat canola oil over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and cook for 5-6 minutes per side, or until golden brown and cooked through (internal temp of 165). Remove from the skillet and let rest before slicing into strips.
In the same skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add minced garlic and saut√© until fragrant, about 1 minute.

Pour in the blended creamy sauce and bring to a simmer. Add in spinach and reduce heat, continuously stirring (add salt and pepper until desired). Cook until the sauce thickens slightly, about 3-4 minutes.
Add the cooked pasta to the skillet and toss to coat in the sauce.
Slice the rested chicken and arrange on top of the pasta.
Garnish with additional Parmesan cheese before serving.
